Research

Hannes Mühleisen is a senior researcher at the Database Architectures group within the Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI). Hannes has been avarded several grants to further his research, among others the NWO VENI and VIDI grants.

Publications

  • These Rows Are Made for Sorting and That's Just What We'll Do, Laurens Kuiper and Hannes Mühleisen, 39th IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE), 2023 [pdf]
  • Data Management for Data Science - Towards Embedded Analytics, Mark Raasveldt and Hannes Mühleisen, Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR), 2020 [pdf]
  • Progressive Indexes: Indexing for Interactive Data Analysis, Pedro Holanda, Mark Raasveldt, Stefan Manegold and Hannes Mühleisen, 46rd International Conference on Very Large Data Bases (VLDB2020), 2020
  • DuckDB: an Embeddable Analytical Database, Mark Raasveldt and Hannes Mühleisen, 2019 ACM SIGMOD/PODS International Conference on Management of Data (SIGMOD'19, Demo), 2019 [pdf]
  • Relational Queries with a Tensor Processing Unit, Pedro Holanda and Hannes Mühleise, 15th International Workshop on Data Management on New Hardware (DaMoN 2019, Short Paper), 2019
  • Automatic Generation of a Hybrid Query Execution Engine, Aleksei Kashuba and Hannes Mühleisen, arXiv preprint, 2018
  • MonetDBLite: An Embedded Analytical Database, Mark Raasveldt and Hannes Mühleisen, arXiv preprint, 2018
  • Database-Inspired Optimizations for Statistical Analysis, Hannes Mühleisen, Alexander Bertram and Maarten-Jan Kallen, Journal of Statistical Software, 2018
  • Fair Benchmarking Considered Difficult: Common Pitfalls In Database Performance Testing, Mark Raasveldt, Pedro Holanda, Tim Gubner and Hannes Mühleisen, 7th International Workshop on Testing Database Systems, 2018 [pdf]
  • Fast in-database cross-matching of high-cadence, high-density source lists with an up-to-date sky model, Bart Scheers, Pim Schellart, Arjen van Elteren, Martin Kersten, Hannes Mühleisen, Steven Bloemen and Paul Groot, Astronomy and Computing, 2018 [pdf]
  • Deep Integration of Machine Learning Into Column Stores, Mark Raasveldt, Pedro Holanda, Hannes Mühleisen and Stefan Manegold, 21st International Conference on Extending Database Technology (EDBT 2018), 2018 [pdf]
  • Don't Hold My Data Hostage - A Case For Client Protocol Redesign, Mark Raasveldt and Hannes Mühleisen, 43rd International Conference on Very Large Data Bases (VLDB2017), 2017 [pdf]
  • Multi-Hypothesis CSV parsing, Till Döhmen, Hannes Mühleisen and Peter Boncz, 29th International Conference on Scientific and Statistical Database Management (SSDBM2017), 2017 [pdf]
  • Scaling Column Imprints using Advanced Vectorization, Lefteris Sidirourgos and Hannes Mühleisen, Thirteenth International Workshop on Data Management on New Hardware (DaMoN 2017), 2017 [pdf]
  • Vectorized UDFs in Column-Stores, Mark Raasveldt and Hannes Mühleisen, 28th International Conference on Scientific and Statistical Database Management (SSDBM2016), 2016 [pdf]
  • Column Store for GWAC: A High Cadence High Density Large-Scale Astronomical Lightcurve Pipeline and Distributed Shared-Nothing Database, Meng Wan, Chao Wu, Sjoerd Mullender, Hannes Mühleisen, Bart Scheers, Ying Zhang, Niels Nes, Martin Kersten and Jianyan Wei, Publications of the Astronomical Society of the Pacific, 2016 [pdf]
  • Uniqueness, Density, and Keyness: Exploring Class Hierarchies, Anja Jentzsch, Hannes Mühleisen and Felix Naumann, Sixth International Workshop on Consuming Linked Data (COLD2015), 2015
  • A round table for multi-disciplinary research on Geospatial and Climate Data, Romulo Goncalves, Milena Ivanova, Kostis Kyzirakos, Foteini Alvanaki, Oscar Rubi-Martinez and Hannes Mühleisen, 11th IEEE International Conference on eScience, 2015
  • Capturing the Laws of (Data) Nature, Hannes Mühleisen, Martin Kersten and Stefan Manegold, 7th Biennial Conference on Innovative Data Systems Research (CIDR), 2015 [pdf]
  • Structural footprints of 12 cities, Calendar 2015, Hannes Mühleisen, Mühleisen + Partner Freie Architekten, 2015 [pdf]
  • Efficient Data Management and Statistics with Zero-Copy Integration, Jonathan Lajus and Hannes Mühleisen, 26th International Conference on Scientific and Statistical Database Management (SSDBM2014), 2014 [pdf]
  • Old Dogs Are Great at New Tricks: Column Stores for IR Prototyping, Hannes Mühleisen, Thaer Samar , Jimmy Lin and Arjen de Vries, The 37th annual ACM SIGIR conference (SIGIR2014), 2014 [pdf]
  • Weaving the Web(VTT) of Data, Thomas Steiner, Hannes Mühleisen, Ruben Verborgh, Pierre-Antoine Champin, Benoît Encelle and Yannick Prié, Linked Data on the Web (LDOW2014), 2014 [pdf]
  • Column Stores as an IR Prototyping Tool, Hannes Mühleisen, Thaer Samar , Jimmy Lin and Arjen de Vries, The 36th European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR2014, Demo), 2014 [pdf]

  • Best of Both Worlds – Relational Databases and Statistics, Hannes Mühleisen and Thomas Lumley, 25th International Conference on Scientific and Statistical Database Management (SSDBM2013), 2013 [pdf]
  • Peak Performance – Remote Memory Revisited, Hannes Mühleisen, Romulo Goncalves and Martin Kersten, Ninth International Workshop on Data Management on New Hardware (DaMoN 2013), 2013 [pdf]

  • Web Data Commons - Extracting Structured Data from Two Large Web Corpora, Hannes Mühleisen and Christian Bizer, Linked Data on the Web (LDOW2012), 2012 [pdf]
  • Sieve: Linked Data Quality Assessment and Fusion, Pablo Mendes, Hannes Mühleisen and Christian Bizer, 2nd International Workshop on Linked Web Data Management (LWDM 2012), 2012
  • Large-Scale Retrieval and Reasoning on Semantic Data using Swarms, Hannes Mühleisen and Kathrin Dentler, IEEE Computational Intelligence Magazine, Vol. 7 Iss. 2, 2012 [pdf]
  • Data Location Optimization for a Self-Organized Distributed Storage System, Hannes Mühleisen, Tilman Walther and Robert Tolksdorf, 2011 Third World Congress on Nature and Biologically Inspired Computing (NaBIC2011), 2011 [pdf]
  • A Survey on Self-Organized Semantic Storage, Hannes Mühleisen, Tilman Walther and Robert Tolksdorf, International Journal of Web Information Systems (IJWIS), Vol. 7 Iss. 3, 2011 [pdf]

  • Multi-Level Indexing in a Distributed Self-Organized Storage System, Hannes Mühleisen, Tilman Walther and Robert Tolksdorf, 2011 IEEE Congress on Evolutionary Computation (CEC2011), 2011 [pdf]
  • Augmenting the Web of Data using Referers, Hannes Mühleisen and Anja Jentzsch, Linked Data on the Web (LDOW2011), 2011 [pdf]
  • Configuring a Self-Organized Semantic Storage Service, Hannes Mühleisen, Tilman Walther, Anne Augustin, Marko Harasic and Robert Tolksdorf, 6th International Workshop on Scalable Semantic Web Knowledge Base Systems (SSWS2010), 2010 [pdf]
  • A Self-Organized Semantic Storage Service, Hannes Mühleisen, Anne Augustin, Tilman Walther, Marko Harasic, Kia Teymourian and Robert Tolksdorf, 12th International Conference on Information Integration and Web-based Applications & Services (iiWAS2010), 2010 [pdf]
  • User-Defined Rules in a Distributed Address Book, Hannes Mühleisen and Adrian Paschke, RuleML-2010 - 4th International Rule Challenges, 2010 [pdf]
  • SWRL-based Access Policies for Linked Data, Hannes Mühleisen, Martin Kost and Johann-Christoph Freytag, 2nd Workshop on Trust and Privacy on the Social and Semantic Web (SPOT2010), 2010 [pdf]
